scenes.background: You emphasized the importance of breaks for productivity, showing good emotional perception and empathy. A few days later, [Monica] and [Bob] continue the discussion during a team meeting.
scenes.description: 'I see your point about needing breaks, but we have to find a way to handle emergencies without relying on time off. Any ideas on how to make this work for everyone?'

options.text: Perhaps we could create a rotating on-call schedule, so everyone gets their time off while still having someone available for emergencies.
options.analysis: You suggested a practical solution, showing good emotional control and balance. However, the response could be more empathetic.

options.text: I think it's essential to have a backup plan where the team can cover for each other without compromising anyone's break.
options.analysis: You emphasized the importance of teamwork and support, showing good emotional perception and empathy. However, it lacks strong social skills.

options.text: While it's important to be prepared, it feels unfair to expect people to give up their break time for emergencies.
options.analysis: You highlighted the need for fair expectations, showing good social skills and motivation. However, empathy and emotional perception were lacking.
